channel.title: Comments on: New rules for travellers to the US

item.title: By: nullMum
item.dc:creator: nullMum
item.description: <p> <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GKU/$File/tongue.gif"</a> /> We have already got ours for our trip in May '09. V easy to do online but we had to do one each - not one per couple<br/><br /><br/><br />Best wishes</p>
item.content:encoded:
http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GKU/$File/tongue.gif“ /> We have already got ours for our trip in May ’09. V easy to do online but we had to do one each – not one per couple

Best wishes

item.title: By: Hans-Peter Kuessner
item.dc:creator: Hans-Peter Kuessner
item.description: <p>We got this information when we booked our flights. From what I understand it will replace the green forms we had to fill in during the flight.<br/><br />It should have one advantage: If you get rejected for any reason you will at least know that before you board the flight (and don't have to fly back on your own cost).<br/><br />On the other hand immigration still can reject you during immigration, if they see you as a security problem <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GK5/$File/huh.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
We got this information when we booked our flights. From what I understand it will replace the green forms we had to fill in during the flight.

It should have one advantage: If you get rejected for any reason you will at least know that before you board the flight (and don’t have to fly back on your own cost).

On the other hand immigration still can reject you during immigration, if they see you as a security problem http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GK5/$File/huh.gif“ />

item.title: By: Boudewijn
item.dc:creator: Boudewijn
item.description: <p>Hi,<br /><br />According my information before 12 January it's a test. After 12 January you have to do this 3 days in advance. So if you don't do it you will not allow you to travel to the US. <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHR/$File/angry.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

According my information before 12 January it’s a test. After 12 January you have to do this 3 days in advance. So if you don’t do it you will not allow you to travel to the US. http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHR/$File/angry.gif“ />

item.title: By: Kai Benjaminsen
item.dc:creator: Kai Benjaminsen
item.description: <p>I got the same info from my travel agency when booking flight tickets. It's the same green slip that you earlier filled out on the plane, but now it's electronic. <br /><br />I'm not sure if you actually need it, but I will bring with me a note of the reference number for the VISA waiver. Just to be on the safe side.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I got the same info from my travel agency when booking flight tickets. It’s the same green slip that you earlier filled out on the plane, but now it’s electronic.

I’m not sure if you actually need it, but I will bring with me a note of the reference number for the VISA waiver. Just to be on the safe side.

item.title: By: Peter Smith
item.dc:creator: Peter Smith
item.description: <p>Not had that email yet, strange... is this different to the info we supply online to Virgin when booking flights?<br/><br /><br/><br />There was nothing (that I recall) on the Virgin website about extra requirements).<br/><br /><br/><br />Most odd.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Not had that email yet, strange… is this different to the info we supply online to Virgin when booking flights?

There was nothing (that I recall) on the Virgin website about extra requirements).

Most odd.
